issue.body:
New type of YouTube ads is blocked by our filters. If that does not help, try using our script by following the instructions below.

---

Please enable AdGuard Extra in AdGuard settings (for app users).

---

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
It looks like that problem is not related to filters and SSL certificate for `127.0.0.1` (which I guess is installed and used by this plugin) isn't trusted by the browser when AdGuard is used.

<details><summary>Screenshots</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29142494/209076516-7fca5046-6588-4b4b-935a-a0aca2f2bd55.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29142494/209076531-844a5d6d-d322-4726-8cc5-3b4ec36933c1.png)

</details>

Could you please try to open AdGuard's settings and in `General Settings` go to `Advanced Settings` and disable `Filter localhost` option and then save settings (like on a screenshots below)?

<details><summary>Screenshots</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29142494/209076784-00641a2b-ac0d-48fa-8eac-3e9f9c31439f.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29142494/209076794-5e2578ba-9dae-4c1f-b54e-45513807567e.png)

</details>

Or you can also try to add `127.0.0.1` to HTTPS exclusions - Settings -> `Network` tab - HTTPS filtering section - `Exclusions` (screenshots below).

<details><summary>Screenshots</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29142494/209077085-c1d5f01e-ee1d-413c-96c8-78c667519928.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29142494/209077094-29b7adfe-dcf8-4c16-9bd2-5a349497293d.png)

</details>
